name: Stuffed Paratha
history: Stuffed Paratha is a beloved Indian flatbread, traditionally filled with various ingredients. It's a versatile dish enjoyed across the country.
description: Stuffed Paratha is a delicious Indian flatbread, filled with a spiced mixture. Popular fillings include potato, paneer, and mixed vegetables.

equipment.name: mixing bowl
equipment.description: For preparing the dough and mixing the filling.

ingredients.description: A mixture of boiled and mashed potatoes, seasoned with spices like turmeric, chili powder, and cumin.

instructions.title: Make the Dough
instructions.description: Combine whole wheat flour, salt, and water to form a soft dough. Knead well and let it rest.

instructions.title: Prepare the Filling
instructions.description: Mix boiled, mashed potatoes with spices such as turmeric, chili powder, cumin, salt, and chopped herbs.

instructions.title: Roll and Stuff
instructions.description: Divide the dough into balls. Roll each ball, place a portion of filling in the center, and seal. Roll again to flatten.

instructions.title: Cook the Parathas
instructions.description: Heat a skillet. Cook each paratha with oil until golden brown on both sides.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve hot with yogurt, butter, or pickle.

tips: Ensure the filling is not too moist to prevent the parathas from tearing.
Cook on medium heat for even cooking.
variations: Try different fillings like paneer, cauliflower, or minced meat.
Add grated cheese to the potato filling for a cheesy twist.

storage.shelfLife: Parathas can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat on a skillet before serving.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a skillet or in a microwave until warm.
presentationTips: Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with a side of chutneys.
